title: Female Nude Reclining with Arm Raised

thumbnail.alt_text: A work made of pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash on tan laid paper.

artist_display:
Attributed to Aert de Gelder
Dutch, 1645-1727
medium_display: Pen and brown ink and brush and brown wash on tan laid paper
publication_history:
Art Institute of Chicago, Bulletin of the Art Institute of Chicago 18:1 (February 1949), p. 12 (ill.).

Agnes Mongan, ed., One Hundred Master Drawings (Cambridge, 1949), p. 92–93 (ill.).

Marilyn Robb, “Art News from Chicago,” Art News 18:8 (December 1949), p. 50 (ill.).

Otto Benesch, The Drawings of Rembrandt V (London, 1957), p. 304, no. 1127, fig. 1423 (as Rembrandt).

J. G. van Gelder, Dutch Drawings and Prints (London, 1959), p. 47, no. 70 (ill.).

Roger-Marx, Claude, Rembrandt (Paris: Pierre Tisné, 1960), pp. 293–294, no. 121d (ill) (as Rembrandt).

Walther Scheidig, Rembrandt als Zeichner (Leipzig: E. A. Seemann, 1962), p. 59, pl. 137 (as Rembrandt).

Joseph-Émile Muller, Rembrandt (Paris, 1968), p. 233-234 (ill.) and 271.

Robert Hale and Terrence Coyle, Anatomy Lessons from the Great Masters (1977), p. 140 (ill.).

Nathan Goldstein, Figure Drawing: The Structure, Anatomy, and Expressive Design of  Human Form, 4 ed. (Englewood Cliffs, New Jersey, 2004), pp. 325-326, fig. 7.31.

Shelley Perlove and George S. Keyes (editors), Seventeenth-Century European Drawings in Midwestern Collections (Notre Dame, Ind.: University of Notre Dame Press, 2015) p. 173 (as Arent de Gelder).
exhibition_history:
Cambridge, Mass., Fogg Art Museum, Harvard University, "Seventy Master Drawings," Nov. 27, 1948-Jan. 6, 1949, n.p., cat. 37.

Rotterdam, the Museum Boymans van Beuningen, "Rembrandt," May 18-Aug. 5, 1956, pp. 170-171, cat. 235; also Amsterdam, Rijksmuseum, August 8-Oct. 21, 1956.

New York, the Pierpont Morgan Library, "Rembrandt: Drawings from American Collections," Mar. 15-Apr. 16, 1960, p. 52, no. 72, pl. 64; also Cambridge, Mass., Fogg Art Museum, Harvard University, Apr. 27-May 29, 1960 (as Rembrandt).

New York, Wildenstein and Company, "Master Drawings from The Art Institute of Chicago," Oct. 17-Nov. 30, 1963, n.p., no. 31, pl. XII (as Rembrandt).

Art Institute of Chicago, "Rembrandt After Three Hundred Years," Oct. 25-Dec. 7, 1969, pp. 175-176 and 228 (ill.), no. 136; also Minneapolis Institute of Arts, Dec. 22, 1969-Feb. 1, 1970, and Detroit Institute of Arts, Feb. 24-Apr. 5, 1970 (as Rembrandt) .

Art Institute of Chicago, "A Quarter Century of Collecting: Drawings Given to The Art Institute of Chicago 1944-1970 by Margaret Day Blake," Apr. 28-Jun. 7, 1970, n.p., no. 9 (ill.) (as Rembrandt).

Art Institute of Chicago, "Imaging the Body: From Fragment To Total Display," January 28-April 28, 1992, cat. by Barbara Maria Stafford, p. 28 (as Rembrandt).

The Art Institute of Chicago, "Rubens, Rembrandt, and Drawing in the Golden Age", September 28, 2019 - January 5, 2020, pp. 126, (ill.), 129-30, 297-98, cat. 40, cat. by Victoria Sancho Lobis, et. al.
provenance_text: M. [Lugt 1841, 1842].  Sold by an unknown bookseller, London, to Colnaghi, London, before 1947 [letter from G. Mayer of Colnaghi dated April 14, 1948]; sold to the Art Institute of Chicago, 1947.

input: Female Nude Reclining with Arm Raised
